TITLE: Initializing Trubrics Client in Python
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the Trubrics client with an API key obtained from the Trubrics dashboard.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from trubrics import Trubrics

client = Trubrics(api_key="your-api-key")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Tracking Events with Trubrics in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to track a simple event and an LLM interaction using the Trubrics client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# Track a simple event
client.track(
    user_id="user123",
    event="button_click",
    properties={"button_type": "submit"},
)

# Track LLM interactions
client.track_llm(
    user_id="user123",
    prompt="What is the capital of France?",
    assistant_id="gpt-4",
    generation="The capital of France is Paris.",
    properties={
        "support_tier": "entreprise",
    },
    latency=1.5,  # seconds
    thread_id="user123_thread_id"
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Trubrics Python Client
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Trubrics Python client using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install trubrics
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Closing Trubrics Client in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to properly close the Trubrics client, ensuring all events are flushed from the queue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
client.close()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Advanced Configuration of Trubrics Client in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to initialize the Trubrics client with custom flush interval and batch size settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from trubrics import Trubrics

client = Trubrics(
    api_key="your-api-key",
    flush_interval=20,
    flush_batch_size=10,
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Logging for Trubrics Client in Python
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to adjust the logging level for the Trubrics client or use a custom logger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
trubrics = Trubrics(api_key="your-api-key")
trubrics.logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

# Or specify your own logger completely:
trubrics = Trubrics(api_key="your-api-key", logger=your_cool_logger)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog
DESCRIPTION: Full changelog document detailing the version history of trubrics-python from version 0.2.3 to 1.8.5. Includes added features, changes, and bug fixes following Keep a Changelog format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [1.8.5] - 2025-03-28
### Added
- prompt_event_name and generation_event_name to track_llm_events

## [1.8.4] - 2025-03-17
### Added
- thread_id to track_llm_events

### Changed
- assistant_id now optional in track_llm_events

## [1.8.3] - 2025-02-26
### Changed
- Change logging level to debug for flushing events and adding event to queue

### Added
- LLM events are now routed to the new publis_llm_events endpoint

## [1.8.2] - 2025-02-10
### Fixed
- Added missing flushing limit values, and setup automated flush if limit is reached
### Changed
- Change LLM tracking latency to seconds and remove default latency from event properties

## [1.8.1] - 2025-02-07
### Fixed
- Fixed error logging when flushing events

## [1.8.0] - 2025-02-06
### Added
- Update logging, removing `is_verbose` parameter
- Removed CONTRIBUTING.md, as info is now in README.md
- Brought back repository to PyPI, and uses uv to build and publish
- Changed name to "trubrics" for easier installation
```

TITLE: Setting Up Development Environment for Trubrics
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up the development environment for Trubrics using Make commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make setup_uv_venv
make install_dev_requirements  # Install development dependencies
make install_requirements     # Install production dependencies
```

TITLE: Publishing New Version of Trubrics to PyPI
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and push a new version tag for Trubrics, triggering automatic publication to PyPI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/trubrics/trubrics-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git tag -a v1.0.0 -m "Release version v1.0.0"
git push origin v1.0.0
```
